chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: Sometimes we have to do repetitions in javascript

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: For example, if I tell you to print numbers from 1 to 10, you will do it by doing console.log

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: But if I tell you to do it from 1 to 1000 or 1 to 1 billion, then you may not be able to do it

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: And for this, loops are used in javascript

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: How is the syntax, what is the for loop, what is the while loop, what is the do while

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: Along with this, we are going to see the for in and for off loop in this video

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: What does loop construct do? It helps you

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: It helps you to do any one of your tasks, repetitive tasks again and again

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: We have five types of loops in JavaScript

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops
chunks.text: There is a for loop, which is a normal for loop

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops

chunks.title: JavaScript Loops

text: Sometimes we have to do repetitions in javascript For example, if I tell you to print numbers from 1 to 10, you will do it by doing console.log But if I tell you to do it from 1 to 1000 or 1 to 1 billion, then you may not be able to do it And for this, loops are used in javascript To automate your repetitive tasks How is the syntax, what is the for loop, what is the while loop, what is the do while Along with this, we are going to see the for in and for off loop in this video Do like this video and write sigma patch op in the comment section below Let's go to the computer screen Let's roll the intro So as I told you, if I tell you to print numbers from 1 to 10, you will do it by doing console.log 1, 2, 3, 4 all the way till 10 But if I tell you to print numbers from 1 to 1000, then you may not be able to do it So to explain this quickly, I will make a folder named 57 and open it in VS Code And I guess my 56 is also open, I will close it And here I will quickly make a file named index.js Note that I am making a javascript file here, I am not making an HTML file But I can put all the code in an HTML script tag As long as I am using all those things that are available in my browser But now because we are learning loops, I will quickly put a console.log here And I will write here I am a tutorial on loops Okay, let me zoom in a little so that you can see And as soon as I run it, it will open in the terminal here If I want, I can also make its tab, which I personally prefer And after this, you see I am a tutorial on loops here You are getting to see Now look at one thing here If I write here let a is equal to 1 And here I write console.log a Then after that I write console.log a plus 1 Then I write console.log a plus 2 There is a limit as long as I can do this I will get tired, my program will become so big Maybe my editor will hang if I write a lot of millions of lines So I don't want my editor to hang And the JavaScript engine also doesn't want my editor to hang That's why JavaScript has a loop construct What does loop construct do? It helps you It helps you to do any one of your tasks, repetitive tasks again and again We have five types of loops in JavaScript There is a for loop, which is a normal for loop One is a for in loop, one is a for off loop And after this there is a while loop and one is a do while loop Let's see how these loops work First of all, I will show you a very basic for loop If you want to do this, I will run this and you will see 1,2,3 But let's say I want to print up to 100 and I will show you If you do it manually, you will get tired And I don't want you to get tired, JavaScript also doesn't want you to get tired That's why it has a loop construct So you say a is equal to 1 And after this you put a for loop Now see, as soon as I wrote for, you notice this One is for, one is for each, one is for in, one is for off So there is a for each loop which we will see later But now you click on this for loop which is our classical for loop You can also go to it with the arrow key If I wrote for, you can also navigate with the arrow key If you don't want to take your hand on the mouse, just in case Hit enter Now if you want to use any other variable instead of index, do it But I let it be index If you change it, it will change 1,2,3,4 places Suppose I prefer only i Or suppose I prefer only a I kept i So it changed where i was Now I will press the tab key on my keyboard I have pressed the tab key Oops, I will press the tab key on the keyboard As soon as I press the tab key on my keyboard Here the name of the array will come Which array length and which item of the array you want to access But because I don't want to access the length of the array Neither I am dealing with the array That's why I will put a number here Which will be let us say 100 And I will write here console.log a plus i So the value of i will vary All the way from 0 to 100 So here I have ruined its closing So you will see here As soon as I run it I can also type this code manually It is not necessary that I bring the for loop of VS Code Hit enter with the arrow key I will show you this thing by toggling the screen cast mode So I did for Then I did this by pressing the arrow key Then I made the index i Then I pressed the tab Then I will remove the name of the array here And I will put a number here So see how this loop works First I will run it If I run it, it will print from 1 to 100 But how did it do it? First of all, it runs this part of the code Only once when the loop is initialized This is called initialization So what will let i equal to 0 do? It will make the value of i zero Then comes the condition Which is checked Is i less than 100? If i is less than 100 Then only it will enter the loop Otherwise it will not enter Now because i is less than 100 0 is less than 100 So it will enter the loop And here it will execute console.log a plus i Which will do 1 plus 100 101 sorry 1 plus 0 The value of i was 0 now 1 plus 0 which was 1 It will print it The value of a plus i is also 1 What will it do after that? It will run it Now the value of i will be 1 If we do 0 plus plus, it will be 1 And what will it do after this? It will check 1 And if it is true, it will run it Then it will run Then it will check If it is true, it will come here Then it will run Then it will check If it is true, it will run it And the value of i will keep updating And from 1 to eventually The value of i will be 100 Then when it will run 100 less than 100 is false 100 less than 100 is false 100 is not less than 100 99 is less than 100 100 is not less than 100 So this will be false And this loop will exit So it works like this And I have given this in the notes Very well to you So what is statement 1? It will be executed for the first time Statement 2 is the condition of the loop Which will be checked The loop will keep running And statement 3 will keep running after that So statement 1 will run At the time of initialization of the loop Then statement 2 will be checked If the loop is true, it will run Then statement 3 will run Then statement 2 will be checked The loop will run Then statement 3 will run Then statement 2 will be checked If it is true, the loop will run Then statement 3 will run And so on till Statement 2 is not false And sometimes it happens that Statement 2 is never false And we call it an infinite loop And if you get stuck in infinite loops Then your browser can also hang This also happens So never write such a code So that your loop Converts into an infinite loop So this is our basic for loop Then what does the for in loop do It gives you the keys of objects This is our basic for loop Which I have already told you Suppose I have an object I write let obj is equal Yes it will be After this i less than 6 Is it true? 5 is less than 6 Yes it is true Print will be 5 Okay Then what will happen? i value will be 6 Will be checked again 6 less than 6 Is it true? No it is false So only 5 will print this code And you can see here Only 5 will print But if I make i value 0 So what will happen?
